Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the tax cuts by stating that the president has "exploded the debt by more than $3 trillion" solely for the purpose of giving tax cuts to the wealthiest few. This ignores other factors and legislation that contributed to the increase in debt.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it fails to provide evidence or specific data to back up the assertion that the tax cuts were the sole cause of the debt increase.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the tax cuts were exclusively for the benefit of the wealthiest few, without considering any potential broader economic effects or benefits to other income groups.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge that there were other bills and legislation, including spending bills supported by Democrats, which also contributed significantly to the increase in debt. This alternative explanation is not addressed in the claim.
